metadata.title: CVE-2024-26805 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netlink: Fix kernel-infoleak-after-free in __skb_datagram_iter syzbotreported the following uninit-value access issue [1]: netlink_to_full_skb()creates a new `skb` and puts the `skb->data` passed as a 1st arg ofnetlink_to_full_skb() onto new `skb`. The data size is specified as `len`and passed to skb_put_data(). This `len` is based on `skb->end` that is notdata offset but buffer offset. The `skb->end` contains data and tailroom.Since the tailroom is not initialized when the new `skb` created, KMSANdetects uninitialized memory area when copying the data. This patchresolved this issue by correct the len from `skb->end` to `skb->len`, whichis the actual data offset.
